verses.kjv: Moreover the word of the LORD came unto Jeremiah the second time, while he was yet shut up in the court of the prison, saying,
verses.web: Moreover LORD’s word came to Jeremiah the second time, while he was still locked up in the court of the guard, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Jeremiah a second time while he was still locked up in the courtyard of the guard.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD the maker thereof, the LORD that formed it, to establish it; the LORD is his name;
verses.web: “LORD who does it, LORD who forms it to establish it—LORD is his name, says:
verses.ct: "This is what the LORD says — the one who made the earth, who shaped it and set it in place. The LORD is his name:

verses.kjv: Call unto me, and I will answer thee, and shew thee great and mighty things, which thou knowest not.
verses.web: ‘Call to me, and I will answer you, and will show you great and difficult things, which you don’t know.’
verses.ct: "'Call out to me, and I will answer you. I will show you great and hidden things you have never known.'

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD, the God of Israel, concerning the houses of this city, and concerning the houses of the kings of Judah, which are thrown down by the mounts, and by the sword;
verses.web: For LORD, the God of Israel, says concerning the houses of this city and concerning the houses of the kings of Judah, which are broken down to make a defense against the mounds and against the sword;
verses.ct: The LORD, the God of Israel, says this about the houses of this city and the palaces of Judah's kings — the ones being torn down to build defenses against the siege ramps and the enemy's swords:

verses.kjv: They come to fight with the Chaldeans, but it is to fill them with the dead bodies of men, whom I have slain in mine anger and in my fury, and for all whose wickedness I have hid my face from this city.
verses.web: while men come to fight with the Chaldeans, and to fill them with the dead bodies of men, whom I have killed in my anger and in my wrath, and for all whose wickedness I have hidden my face from this city:
verses.ct: The people go out to fight the Babylonians, but all they will do is fill those ruins with corpses — the bodies of those I have killed in my anger and fury. I have turned my face away from this city because of all its wickedness.

verses.kjv: Behold, I will bring it health and cure, and I will cure them, and will reveal unto them the abundance of peace and truth.
verses.web: ‘Behold, I will bring it health and cure, and I will cure them; and I will reveal to them abundance of peace and truth.
verses.ct: "But look — I will bring healing and restoration to this city. I will heal its people and show them an overwhelming abundance of peace and security.

verses.kjv: And I will cause the captivity of Judah and the captivity of Israel to return, and will build them, as at the first.
verses.web: I will cause the captivity of Judah and the captivity of Israel to return, and will build them, as at the first.
verses.ct: I will bring the captives of Judah and Israel back home and rebuild them just as they were before.

verses.kjv: And I will cleanse them from all their iniquity, whereby they have sinned against me; and I will pardon all their iniquities, whereby they have sinned, and whereby they have transgressed against me.
verses.web: I will cleanse them from all their iniquity by which they have sinned against me. I will pardon all their iniquities by which they have sinned against me and by which they have transgressed against me.
verses.ct: I will wash away every sin they committed against me. I will forgive all the ways they sinned and rebelled against me.

verses.kjv: And it shall be to me a name of joy, a praise and an honour before all the nations of the earth, which shall hear all the good that I do unto them: and they shall fear and tremble for all the goodness and for all the prosperity that I procure unto it.
verses.web: This city will be to me for a name of joy, for praise, and for glory, before all the nations of the earth, which will hear all the good that I do to them, and will fear and tremble for all the good and for all the peace that I provide to it.’ ”
verses.ct: Then this city will bring me joy, praise, and glory before every nation on earth. When they hear about all the good things I do for my people, they will fear and tremble at the incredible goodness and peace I provide."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; Again there shall be heard in this place, which ye say shall be desolate without man and without beast, even in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, that are desolate, without man, and without inhabitant, and without beast,
verses.web: LORD says: “Yet again there will be heard in this place, about which you say, ‘It is waste, without man and without animal, even in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, that are desolate, without man and without inhabitant and without animal,’
verses.ct: The LORD says: "You look at this place and call it a wasteland — empty of people and animals. You say the same about the cities of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem, that they are deserted, with no one living in them, not even an animal.

verses.kjv: The voice of joy, and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom, and the voice of the bride, the voice of them that shall say, Praise the LORD of hosts: for the LORD is good; for his mercy endureth for ever: and of them that shall bring the sacrifice of praise into the house of the LORD. For I will cause to return the captivity of the land, as at the first, saith the LORD.
verses.web: the voice of joy and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the voice of those who say, ‘Give thanks to LORD of Armies, for LORD is good, for his loving kindness endures forever;’ who bring thanksgiving into LORD’s house. For I will cause the captivity of the land to be reversed as at the first,” says LORD.
verses.ct: But the sounds of joy and celebration will be heard here again — the laughter of brides and grooms, the voices of people singing, 'Give thanks to the LORD of hosts, for the LORD is good, and his mercy endures forever!' They will bring offerings of thanksgiving into the LORD's house. I will reverse the captivity of this land and restore it to what it once was," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; Again in this place, which is desolate without man and without beast, and in all the cities thereof, shall be an habitation of shepherds causing their flocks to lie down.
verses.web: LORD of Armies says: “Yet again there will be in this place, which is waste, without man and without animal, and in all its cities, a habitation of shepherds causing their flocks to lie down.
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts says: "In this place that is now a wasteland — empty of people and animals — and in all its surrounding cities, there will once again be pastures where shepherds rest their flocks.

verses.kjv: In the cities of the mountains, in the cities of the vale, and in the cities of the south, and in the land of Benjamin, and in the places about Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, shall the flocks pass again under the hands of him that telleth them, saith the LORD.
verses.web: In the cities of the hill country, in the cities of the lowland, in the cities of the South, in the land of Benjamin, in the places around Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, the flocks will again pass under the hands of him who counts them,” says LORD.
verses.ct: In the hill country towns, the lowland towns, the towns of the southern desert, the land of Benjamin, the villages around Jerusalem, and the cities of Judah — flocks will once again pass under the shepherd's hand as he counts them," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will perform that good thing which I have promised unto the house of Israel and to the house of Judah.
verses.web: “Behold, the days come,” says LORD, “that I will perform that good word which I have spoken concerning the house of Israel and concerning the house of Judah.
verses.ct: "The time is coming," says the LORD, "when I will fulfill the good promise I made to the people of Israel and Judah.

verses.kjv: In those days, and at that time, will I cause the Branch of righteousness to grow up unto David; and he shall execute judgment and righteousness in the land.
verses.web: “In those days and at that time, I will cause a Branch of righteousness to grow up to David. He will execute justice and righteousness in the land.
verses.ct: When that day comes, I will raise up a righteous Branch from David's line. He will bring justice and righteousness throughout the land.

verses.kjv: In those days shall Judah be saved, and Jerusalem shall dwell safely: and this is the name wherewith she shall be called, The LORD our righteousness.
verses.web: In those days Judah will be saved, and Jerusalem will dwell safely. This is the name by which she will be called: LORD our righteousness.”
verses.ct: In those days, Judah will be rescued and Jerusalem will live in safety. This is the name she will be called: 'The LORD Our Righteousness.'"

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD; David shall never want a man to sit upon the throne of the house of Israel;
verses.web: For LORD says: “David will never lack a man to sit on the throne of the house of Israel.
verses.ct: The LORD says: "There will never be a time when David's line fails to have a descendant sitting on the throne of Israel.

verses.kjv: Neither shall the priests the Levites want a man before me to offer burnt offerings, and to kindle meat offerings, and to do sacrifice continually.
verses.web: The Levitical priests won’t lack a man before me to offer burnt offerings, to burn meal offerings, and to do sacrifice continually.”
verses.ct: And the Levitical priests will never lack a descendant to stand before me, offering burnt offerings, grain offerings, and sacrifices — always."

verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came unto Jeremiah, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.ct: Then the LORD spoke to Jeremiah again:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; If ye can break my covenant of the day, and my covenant of the night, and that there should not be day and night in their season;
verses.web: “LORD says: ‘If you can break my covenant of the day and my covenant of the night, so that there will not be day and night in their time;
verses.ct: "The LORD says: 'If you could somehow break my covenant with the day and my covenant with the night — so that daylight and darkness no longer come at their appointed times —

verses.kjv: Then may also my covenant be broken with David my servant, that he should not have a son to reign upon his throne; and with the Levites the priests, my ministers.
verses.web: then may my covenant also be broken with David my servant, that he won’t have a son to reign on his throne; and with the Levites the priests, my ministers.
verses.ct: only then could my covenant with my servant David be broken, so that he would have no descendant to reign on his throne. Only then could my covenant with the Levitical priests who serve me be broken.

verses.kjv: As the host of heaven cannot be numbered, neither the sand of the sea measured: so will I multiply the seed of David my servant, and the Levites that minister unto me.
verses.web: As the army of the sky can’t be counted, and the sand of the sea can’t be measured; so I will multiply the offspring of David my servant and the Levites who minister to me.’ ”
verses.ct: Just as the stars in the sky cannot be counted and the sand on the seashore cannot be measured, so I will multiply the descendants of my servant David and the Levites who minister to me.'"

verses.kjv: Moreover the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Jeremiah again:

verses.kjv: Considerest thou not what this people have spoken, saying, The two families which the LORD hath chosen, he hath even cast them off? thus they have despised my people, that they should be no more a nation before them.
verses.web: “Don’t consider what this people has spoken, saying, ‘Has LORD cast off the two families which he chose?’ Thus they despise my people, that they should be no more a nation before them.”
verses.ct: "Have you noticed what these people are saying? They claim, 'The LORD chose 2 families but has now rejected them both.' They look down on my people as if Israel is no longer a nation in their eyes."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; If my covenant be not with day and night, and if I have not appointed the ordinances of heaven and earth;
verses.web: LORD says: “If my covenant of day and night fails, if I have not appointed the ordinances of heaven and earth;
verses.ct: The LORD says: "If I had not established my covenant with day and night — if I had not set the laws that govern heaven and earth —

verses.kjv: Then will I cast away the seed of Jacob, and David my servant, so that I will not take any of his seed to be rulers over the seed of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob: for I will cause their captivity to return, and have mercy on them.
verses.web: then I will also cast away the offspring of Jacob, and of David my servant, so that I will not take of his offspring to be rulers over the offspring of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob: for I will cause their captivity to be reversed and will have mercy on them.”
verses.ct: then I might reject the descendants of Jacob and my servant David, refusing to choose any of David's offspring to rule over the descendants of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. But I will never do that. Instead, I will reverse their captivity and show them mercy."
